intro: Angianthus, commonly known as the "golden crown" or "false dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers, which are typically arranged in a single, showy head. Angianthus species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to withstand drought conditions. They are popular in gardens for their striking appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
